benchmark_details.name: DVBench
benchmark_details.overview: DVBench is a pioneering benchmark designed to evaluate the performance of Vision Large Language Models (VLLMs) in understanding safety-critical driving videos. It features 10,000 multiple-choice questions with human-annotated ground-truth answers, enabling a comprehensive evaluation of VLLMsâ€™ capabilities in perception and reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To rigorously assess the perception and reasoning capabilities of Vision Large Language Models in safety-critical driving scenarios.

data.source: Curated multiple-choice questions derived from safety-critical driving videos and associated annotations.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the percentage of correct answers across multiple evaluations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in understanding complex driving scenarios.
methodology.validation: The evaluation framework includes a hierarchical ability taxonomy and rigorous quality checks.
